children.text: Do not Create, Uncover Great Ideas

In general, my brain does not work as others.  I often reach different conclusions from the same data.  I often do not see what others do and see things other do not. I think of this as my superpower.

When I was younger I thought that mean that I was good at coming up with great ideas, (turns out original does not mean great).  But I have come to understand, that while it does not generate great ideas it does help to uncover them.  And nowadays I think of myself less as the mad scientist and more as an archaeologist.

Step one of extracting great ideas is finding lots of ideas (that where the good ones are).  I find this done best by discussing random topics within the large diverse communities in a variety of contexts.
